entries.name: Brittle
entries: You are vulnerable to bludgeoning damage, but resistant to slashing and piercing damage.

entries.name: Undead
entries: You are considered undead not humanoid for spells and effects.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: You are immune to disease and the poisoned condition, and you have resistance to poison damage. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food or drink if you wish. Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state, but resting in this way is otherwise identical to sleeping. Magically induced sleep can cause you to enter this inactive state.

entries.name: Bonepile
entries: When reduced to 0 hp instead of making death saves you can choose to fall prone to a pile of magical bones while in this state you can not move or take actions except to end the effect and you are immune to all damage and conditions. A dispel magic or similar effect will end this effect early.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, and one other language that your creator knew

entries.name: Size
entries: Skeletons are usually made from a human corpse and thus are usually around 5 or 6 ft. Your size is Medium. A human skeleton is usually around 20 or 30 lbs.

entries.name: Age
entries: Skeletons don’t age, they can theoretically live forever. They appear the same as when they were created.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most skeletons are evil and corrupted by the necromantic energy that fuels them. They are usually created with a purpose in mind or to do a necromancers bidding.

spell.name: Negative Energy Binding

components.m: A small piece of troll’s flesh

entries: When you cast this spell your weapon or ammunition becomes coated in necrotic energy that drains the healing energy of any creatures it attaches to.

On each of your turns for the duration, the first time you hit a creature with a weapon attack you deal an additional 1d8 necrotic damage. When a creature is hit by this effect the energy attaches to the creature and it can’t regain hit points until the spell ends or you the energy binds to a new creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher increase the damage it deals by 1d8 for each spell level above 1st.

default: (a) a {@item shortbow|phb} and {@item quiver|phb} of {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows} or (b) a {@item shortsword|phb}
(a) a {@item burglar's pack|phb}, (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}, or (c) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
{@item Leather armor|phb}, two {@item dagger|phb|daggers}, and {@item metallurgy kit|AudXHomebrew}

classFeatures.name: Expertise
entries: At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with {@item metallurgy kit|AudXHomebrew}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with {@item metallurgy kit|AudXHomebrew}) to gain this benefit.

classFeatures.name: Allomancy
entries: At 1st level, you gain access to allomancy and learn the first ability of each of the metals. You gain choose a new allomantic ability each level.

classFeatures.name: Metallurgy
entries: At 1st level, as a Mistborn understanding how metal vials are made is important. Not all mistborn are experts with metallurgy kits but each one should know how to make their own metals and how to properly combine different metals into a single vial, you gain proficiency with the metallurgy kit.

classFeatures.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

entries.name: Thrown Weapons
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make when throwing a weapon or using your steal/iron attacks and saves.

entries.name: Unarmored Fighter
entries: While you are not wearing armor, you gain a bonus to AC equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up).

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Mariner
entries: As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

entries.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one {@filter maneuver|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV;MV:B} of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master archetype. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain one superiority die, which is a {@dice d6} (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Blind Fighting
entries: Being unable to see a creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it, provided the creature isn't hidden from you.

entries.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target that is within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or a simple or martial weapon to use this reaction.

entries.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.
In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier. If you strike with two free hands, the {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}.

When you successfully start a grapple, you can deal {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage to the grappled creature. Until the grapple ends, you can also deal this damage to the creature whenever you hit it with a melee attack.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Specialty
entries: At 3rd level, you choose one of the subsets of allomancy to focus on as your primary Physical (steel, iron, Pewter, Tin) Mental (Zinc, Brass, Copper, Bronze), Enhancement (Nicrosil, Aluminium, Aluminum, Chromium), Temporal (Electrum, Gold, Bendalloy, Cadmium).

When you choose this and again at levels 6, 9, 13, 17 you can choose an extra ability from your chosen subset. If you already have all of the available abilities from your subset choose a second subset to specialize in and so forth.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeatures.name: Expertise
entries: At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with {@item thieves' tools|phb}) to gain the benefit of Expertise.

classFeatures.name: Evasion
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an {@spell ice storm} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Specialty
entries: At 9th level, you choose an extra ability of your primary subset. Physical (steel, iron, Pewter, Tin) Mental (Zinc, Brass, Copper, Bronze), Enhancement (Nicrosil, Aluminium, Aluminum, Chromium), Temporal (Electrum, Gold, Bendalloy, Cadmium).
If you already have all of the available abilities from your subset choose a second subset to specialize in and so forth.

This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeatures.name: Instant Burn
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you rely on having your metals ready in combat and can quickly begin burning your metals in a moments notice. Burning metals only takes you a bonus action and you can begin burning metals when initiative is rolled by expending 1 charge of the metals you want to begin burning.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Natural Reserve
entries: At 14th level your body has grown accustomed to the metals you burn and has grown resistant to the poisons they can cause. You no longer need to burn away your excess metals at night and can continue or start burning them while you are unconscious.
You also have advantage against saving throws against poisons and disease.

classFeatures.name: Metallic Specialist
entries: At 15th level choose one of the metals from a category you specialize in, your body can now naturally create this metal allowing you to have extra reserves of the chosen metal.
After finishing a long rest you have a minimum of 6 vials worth of your chosen metal ready to burn and your chosen metal burns at a quarter of the normal rate.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Flight
entries: at 18th level while you burn iron and steel and are within 90 ft of an anchor you are considered to have a flight speed of 60ft

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Savant
entries: At 20th level you have reached the pinnacle of what allomancy is capable of you are now considered a savant in all metals but no longer suffer the drawbacks of being a savant. Burning is now a free action for you.

items.name: Metallurgy Kit
entries: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of weights and scales, chemicals used to clean metals, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to analyze or craft metal vials.
additionalEntries: Perhaps the most common tools used by adventurers, metallurgy kit are designed for picking locks and foiling traps. Proficiency with the tools also grants you a general knowledge of traps and locks.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Metallurgy Kits includes a small file, a set of weights and scales, chemicals used to clean metals, and a pair of pliers.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: Your knowledge of metallurgy grants you insight when answering questions about allomancy.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation and Perception
entries: You gain additional insight when looking for metals or to check the quality of a metal vial, because you have learned a variety of common signs that betray their presence.

additionalEntries.name: Craft a vial of metals
entries: You can attempt to prepare a vial of metals or craft a packet of metal dust. With at least one packet of metals and a vial you can make a check adding your metallurgy kit bonus. If you roll below a 9 you prepare one vial, if you roll below a 19 you prepare 2, anything higher and you prepare 3. Given a source of metal you can make the same check to attempt to extract the metal to create a metals packet.

optionalfeatures.name: Steel
entries: One of the most complicated allomantic abilities it allows the art of burning steel to push metals away in a straight line from the user's center of gravity there are 2 general rules for steelpushing, which also apply to ironpulling, its paired opposite. The first rule is that the strength of your push is roughly proportional to your physical weight. This means that larger Allomancers can generally steelpush and ironpull more powerfully than a smaller counterpart. While proportional, the force exerted by a steelpush is much greater than the Coinshot's weight, allowing them to push themselves into the air by pushing on a piece of metal that is on the ground (or is anchored to something that weighs more than they do). The second rule is that metal that is at least partially inside a person's body cannot be affected by steel. Both of these rules can be overcome by a sufficiently strong Coinshot, however.

entries.caption: Powers
rows: While burning you can see blue lines leading to each source of metal within 30 ft you can push on any of these lines as an action to push the metal way from yourself.

While burning push on small bits of metal to launch them gain the ability to make a ranged attack roll using Int with a range of 30/60 on a hit it deals 1d6 piercing damage. The item must weigh at least around as much as a copper piece.

While burning use an action to Drop a piece of metal on the ground to push yourself 30 ft into the air you can stay there as long as you continue pushing, if you leave your original horizontal position, at the end of your turn you fall to the ground.
While burning push on multiple pieces of metal in you hand to create a shotgun effect each creature in a 15 ft cone must make a dex save (DC int) or take 1d6 piercing damage.
While falling you use a reaction to expend a charge to drop a piece of metal and catch yourself.
While burning you can imbue your metal weapons with extra force add your int to damage rolls you make with metal weapons within 30 ft.
While burning you can use your reaction to give an attack roll made with a metal weapon a negative to hit equal to your prof bonus
While burning you have learned to create always push on the area around you all attacks against you made with metal weapons have disadvantage to hit.
